Michael P. Church papers, 1933-1975

Finding aid created by
Michigan Historical Collections staff

did.abstract: Director of cultural activities of the Extension Service of the University of Michigan. Material relating to the National Youth Administration and the effect of the depression on Michigan youth; files collected relating to Michigan cultural organizations, art festivals and exhibitions; notebooks containing biographical information on Michigan artists; and photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Michael Church (donor no. 2313) began depositing materials with the library in 1947. He made numerous yearly deposits until his death.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Michael P. Church papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Michael P. Church was with the Extension Service of the University of Michigan for twenty-nine years before his retirement in 1974. He began as the supervisor of the Saginaw area extension program in 1946. In 1952, he was named supervisor of state-wide and community projects in art, music, theater, and creative writing. In 1962, he was appointed assistant director of the Extension Service and in 1971, he became director of cultural activities. In addition to these responsibilities, from 1960 to 1974, Church was also a lecturer in art at the University of Michigan College of Architecture and Design.

A native of Detroit, Church studied art at the Wicker Art School, Cranbrook Academy of Wayne State University, and the University of Michigan. In his career, Church attained a reputation as art lecturer and critic. He was once described by Reader's Digest as "Michigan's Evangelist of Art" for his popular talks and lectures, for his nurturing of Michigan artists, and for his work with numerous cultural and art organizations.

scopecontent.p: The Michael Church collection has been arranged into the following series: Biographical/personal; Cultural Organizations and Programs; Michigan Artists; Programs of Art Exhibitions; Audio-Visual Material; Clippings; and Other activities and interests. Of special interests are the files of collected information about local Michigan art organizations and the binders containing biographical information about Michigan artists.
